description: Schema for Saleor Configurator YAML configuration files. This defines all available fields, their types, and validation rules for managing Saleor e-commerce store configuration as code.

shop.description: Global shop configuration settings that apply across all channels and define store-wide behavior

headerText.description: Text displayed in the shop header

trackInventoryByDefault.description: Whether new products should track inventory by default

automaticFulfillmentDigitalProducts.description: Automatically fulfill digital products upon payment

defaultDigitalMaxDownloads.description: Maximum downloads allowed for digital products

defaultDigitalUrlValidDays.description: Days that download links remain valid

defaultMailSenderAddress.description: Default email address for outgoing emails

customerSetPasswordUrl.description: URL where customers can set their password

reserveStockDurationAnonymousUser.description: Minutes to reserve stock for anonymous users

reserveStockDurationAuthenticatedUser.description: Minutes to reserve stock for authenticated users

enableAccountConfirmationByEmail.description: Require email confirmation for new accounts

channels.description: Sales channels define different storefronts or markets with their own currency, country, and settings. Each channel can have different pricing, availability, and configuration

currencyCode.description: Currency used for pricing in this channel

defaultCountry.description: Default country for shipping and tax calculations

slug.description: URL-friendly identifier (used in URLs and API calls)

isActive.description: Whether this channel is currently active and accepting orders

allocationStrategy.description: Strategy for allocating stock when multiple locations have inventory

automaticallyConfirmAllNewOrders.description: Automatically confirm all new orders without manual review

automaticallyFulfillNonShippableGiftCard.description: Automatically fulfill gift cards and other non-shippable items

expireOrdersAfter.description: Minutes after which unpaid orders expire

deleteExpiredOrdersAfter.description: Days after which expired orders are permanently deleted

markAsPaidStrategy.description: Strategy for marking orders as paid - transaction flow (recommended) or legacy payment flow

allowUnpaidOrders.description: Allow creation of orders without immediate payment

includeDraftOrderInVoucherUsage.description: Include draft orders when calculating voucher usage limits

useLegacyErrorFlow.description: Use legacy error handling for checkout (for backward compatibility)

automaticallyCompleteFullyPaidCheckouts.description: Automatically complete checkouts when payment is fully captured

defaultTransactionFlowStrategy.description: Default payment flow - authorize first then capture, or charge immediately

currencyCode.description: Currency used for pricing in this channel

defaultCountry.description: Default country for shipping and tax calculations

slug.description: URL-friendly identifier (used in URLs and API calls)

isActive.description: Whether this channel is currently active and accepting orders

warehouses.description: Warehouse definitions with physical locations for storing and fulfilling products. Each warehouse can be assigned to shipping zones and channels for multi-location fulfillment

shippingZones.description: Shipping zone configurations that define geographical regions, associated warehouses, and available shipping methods with pricing rules

productTypes.description: Product type templates that define the structure and attributes for groups of similar products. Each product must be assigned to a product type

isShippingRequired.description: Whether products of this type require shipping (false for digital products)

productAttributes.description: Attributes that apply to the entire product (e.g., Brand, Material)

anyOf.description: Reference to an existing attribute by slug

variantAttributes.description: Attributes that can vary between product variants (e.g., Size, Color)

anyOf.description: Reference to an existing attribute by slug

pageTypes.description: Page type templates that define the structure and attributes for CMS pages. Useful for creating structured content like blog posts, landing pages, etc

name.description: Name of the page type (e.g., 'Blog Post', 'Landing Page', 'Help Article')

attributes.description: Attributes available for pages of this type (e.g., Author, Published Date, Tags)

anyOf.description: Reference to an existing attribute by slug

name.description: Name of the page type (e.g., 'Blog Post', 'Landing Page', 'Help Article')

categories.description: Hierarchical product categorization system. Categories can have subcategories and help organize products for navigation and filtering

slug.description: URL-friendly identifier (used in URLs and API calls)

products.description: Individual product definitions including variants, attributes, and channel-specific settings like pricing and availability

name.description: Product name as displayed to customers

slug.description: URL-friendly identifier (used in URLs and API calls)

productType.description: Reference to the product type (must match a productType name)

category.description: Reference to the product category (must match a category slug)

channelListings.description: Channel-specific settings like pricing and availability

isPublished.description: Whether the product is published and visible in this channel

visibleInListings.description: Whether the product appears in category listings

availableForPurchase.description: ISO date when the product becomes available for purchase

publishedAt.description: ISO date when the product was published

variants.description: Product variants with different SKUs, attributes, or pricing

sku.description: Stock keeping unit - unique identifier for this variant

weight.description: Product weight (in the shop's default unit)

digital.description: Whether this is a digital product (no shipping required)

costPrice.description: Cost price for internal tracking and profit calculations

slug.description: URL-friendly identifier (used in URLs and API calls)

subcategories.description: Child categories nested under this category

title: Saleor Configurator Configuration Schema
